content: Yes, that's correct! Emperor Penguins, just like many other penguin species, huddle together in large groups known as "rookeries" to keep warm in the cold Antarctic climate. These rookeries can contain thousands of penguins and are important for protecting the birds from extreme weather conditions, such as strong winds and snow. The penguins rotate positions within the huddle so that each bird gets a chance to be in the warmer center of the group.
